alert.note: Alert for Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 2:52PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PAGE AND THE SOUTHERN END OF LAKE POWELL IN COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM MST... At 251 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Antelope Island, or near Page, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Page, Page Airport, Glen Canyon Dam, Lower Antelope Canyon, Labyrinth Canyon, Trapeze Cove, Antelope Island, Wahweap, Big Five, NMS Beach, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Antelope Point Marina, Owl Canyon, Stateline Wash Slot Canyon, and Rattlesnake Canyon. This includes the following highways... State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 545 and 556. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
